Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ribosome-inactivating protein TAP-29 (rRNA N-glycosidase; Plant defensin)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the ribosome-inactivating protein family (Type 1 RIP subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: No MICs found in DRAMP database
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Capable of inhibiting HIV-1 infection and replication. It inactivates eukaryotic 60S ribosomal subunits.
Sequence Information.Catalytic activity: Endohydrolysis of the N-glycosidic bond at one specific adenosine on the 28S rRNA.

Literature.Title: TAP 29 an anti-human immunodeficiency virus protein from Trichosanthes kirilowii that is nontoxic to intact cells.
Literature.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 1991 Aug 1;88(15)6570-4.
Literature.Author: Lee-Huang S, Huang PL, Kung HF, Li BQ, Huang PL, Huang P, Huang HI, Chen HC.
